Paper.Title: A corpus-based approach to topic in Danish dialog[?]

Section.Paragraph: We report on an investigation of the pragmatic category of topic in Danish dialog and its correlation to surface features of NPs. Using a corpus of 444 utterances, we trained a decision tree system on 16 features. The system achieved near-human performance with success rates of 84-89% and F1-scores of 0.63-0.72 in 10-fold cross validation tests (human performance: 89% and 0.78). The most important features turned out to be preverbal position, definiteness, pronominalisation, and non-subordination. We discovered that NPs in epistemic matrix clauses (e.g. "I think . . . ") were seldom topics and we suspect that this holds for other inter-personal matrix clauses as well.
